description.narrative: This investment will have the following development impact: (a) provide essential residential infrastructure to support the ongoing rapid urbanization in India, resulting in improved sanitation and health conditions; (b) demonstration effect for attracting private capital to the affordable housing sector in India; and (c) demonstration effect with regard to use of construction technology to shorten delivery times as well as eco-friendly practices. Compared to conventional constructions, the Project is expected to use 35% less water and meet IFC''s green building standards that results in at least a 20% lower energy consumption.

Value and Budget Housing Corporation (VBHC or the Company) is headquartered in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. The Company was incorporated in 2008, with a focus on building affordable and entry level housing in India. VBHC has projects under various stages of development and construction across Bengaluru, Chennai (state of Tamil Nadu) and Mumbai (state of Maharashtra). Further, the Company is in various stages of identification and procurement of land for developing affordable housing in the states of Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Uttar Pradesh (the Project). VBHC is in the process of raising capital from IFC for part-financing the development of the above affordable housing projects.
